text: Aspergillus allahabadii is a species of fungus in the genus Aspergillus. It is from the Terrei section. The species was first described in 1962.Mehrotra, B.S.; Agnihotri, V.P. 1962. Two new species of Aspergillus from India. Mycologia. 54(4):400-406 It has been reported to produce asperphenamate, atrovenetins, butyrolactones, citrinin, and gregatins. ==Growth and morphology== A. allahabadii has been cultivated on both Czapek yeast extract agar (CYA) plates and Malt Extract Agar Oxoid® (MEAOX) plates. The growth morphology of the colonies can be seen in the pictures below. Aspergillus_allahabadii_cya.png|Aspergillus allahabadii growing on CYA plate Aspergillus_allahabadii_meaox.png|Aspergillus allahabadii growing on MEAOX plate == References == allahabadii Category:Fungi described in 1962
title: Aspergillus allahabadii
